title: Model
description: This schema defines the Model part of a Service Description.

model.description: The part of a service description that tells a service requester how to construct an invocation message and interpret a response message.

interface.description: A named set (logical grouping) of operations.

operation.description: Zero or more operations offered by the interface.

idempotent.description: A value that indicates whether the operation is idempotent or not.

synchronous.description: A value that indicates whether the operation is synchronous or not (asynchronous).

message-exchange-pattern.description: A value that indicates the pattern of message exchange between interacting components.

message.description: Zero or more messages associated with the operation.

direction.description: A value that indicates whether the message is input (in) or output (out).

header.description: A collection of zero or more name-value pairs (fields) that provides information about how the message should be processed or interpreted.

name.description: The name of the header field.

description.description: A description of the header field.

permissible-value.description: The set of allowable values of the header field.

payload.description: The actual (business) data transferred by a message.

payload-type.description: A value that indicates the format of the data transferred by the message.

data-entity.description: A basic unit of identifiable and definable data.

name.description: The name of the data entity.

description.description: A description of the data entity.

data-definition.description: A reference to the resource that defines and describes the meaning, structure, inter-relationships, permissible values, format and other aspects of a data entity. Possible examples are an XML schema file, a data model diagram, a common information exchange model such as AIXM, or some other resource that describes the data entity.

fault.description: A message that is returned as a result of an error that prevents a service from implementing a required function.

fault-id.description: An identifier used to designate or identify the fault.

direction.description: A value that indicates fault data is always transferred out of the system.
